title: Allowing robots to explore on their own
summary: The Autonomous Exploration Research Team has developed robotic systems and planners that enable robots to autonomously explore and map unknown environments. The systems use a combination of sensors and algorithms to allow robots to navigate and create maps in real-time. The team has tested the systems in various indoor and outdoor locations, including underground mines and parking garages. The systems can be used in different modes, including manual control, point-to-point navigation, and pure exploration. The new systems are more efficient and can work in low-light and challenging conditions. The team's exploration system was used in a competition and won an award for mapping the most sectors. The team is open-sourcing their work to contribute to the development of autonomous exploration robots.
